content:
‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Hi @Terminator1111 and thanks for your good Job :+1: !
=> I agree with your Contribution ...

Bellow is my 9 lines Python code :
n = int(input())
m=["Send Message","Acknowledge","Receive Notification","Update Status"]
a=["null"]
i=0
while(n>0):
 #print(n, i, n & 1, file=sys.stderr, flush=True)
 if(n&1):a+=[m[i]]
 i+=1;n>>=1
if(len(a)>1):del a[0]
print(*a,sep="\n")

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: fun idea

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I accept this contribution because this is a very good work and a very nice Clash of code.

Nice clash, pretty simple but still fun :)

I think it would be interesting to see this clash in shortest mode too, instead of just fastest

Input
* Please move "Each bit set to 1 ‚Ä¶ 8: Update Status" to Goal section.

Output
* Please change the output format so that it is not Java-specific. (Players of other programming language cannot just print the answer without formatting like your code does.)

Constraints
* Please format ùëõ as a [[variable]].

Cases
* Except for the edge cases of 0 and 15, each pair of test and validator should be similar but remain different. Please change the other pairs of cases accordingly.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement, e.g. "write actions".

Thanks.

Hello,

It's a good proposal for a clash, but you have to make sure that the tests and validators are similar but remain different.
Hi, thanks for your feedback. Tests and validators are similar but different now, except for edge cases, i.e., 0 and 15.

Thank you for your feedback. I have implemented all the suggested changes except for the output format. I see no reason why other programming languages cannot produce output in the [ ] format. Some languages offer direct methods to format lists this way, while in others, we can achieve the same result through manual string concatenation.
Thanks for the feedback. I changed the modes to both fastest and shortest.
I didn't say other programming languages could not produce that format. I said others could not just print that out directly without additional code. So it's unfair.

I'd also like to quote the relevant part of the contribution guidelines for your reference:

"‚Ä¶language-specific outputs should be avoided in CoC.

Some output formats favor specific languages and make the contribution unbalanced."

https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/contribution-guidelines
Thanks, I just changed the output format and updated test cases as well.

Thank you for following up.

Output
* First sentence: Please add ", one enabled action per line, in the same order as the list of actions in the statement".

* Second sentence: Please change it to:
If no action is enabled, print {{null}}.

Thanks again.
Updated. Thanks for your all feedback; it's really helpful insight to me as a first-time contributor.
